result.execSummary:
The defendant Sundance NMI Johnson Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
1) Court waived $18 in statutory court costs.
2) All costs, fees, and other surcharges have been paid in full from the bond funds posted in this matter.
3) The defendant must provide DNA; the analysis may be expunged upon application to the Department of Justice.
Defendant shall not use or possess firearms for life.
Defendant shall not vote in any election until their civil rights are restored.

1) The defendant shall undergo regular drug testing.
2) The defendant shall obtain a valid driver's license.
3) The defendant shall complete a cognitive thinking program.
4) The defendant shall complete all programming required by the Department of Corrections.

Defendant shall complete an OWI Assessment and Driver Safety Plan (as ordered in previous cases) and follow all recommendations so that he may obtain a valid driver's license.

Burnett County cases 20CT45 and 21CF49 were DRI.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Sundance NMI Johnson Sr
Current: 3321 Billy Boy Ln, Shell Lake, WI 54871 United States  (Effective: 07-18-2022)
Prior: 2208 Short Street #7, Luck, WI 54853

02:43 PM Cases 22CF08, 21CF49, and 20CT45 called together.  Defendant Sundance NMI Johnson in court with attorney Eugene D Harrington.  Defendant in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Harrington: plead to  Ct 1 in 22CF8: Possession of Methamphetamine, remaining counts and cases to be DRI.  Parties to waive PSI, joint recommendation for 2 years probation.  Discussion of def's driver's license.  Court reviews PLQ.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Defs constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for plea.  Def enters a plea of Guilty.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1 of 22CF08: Possession of methamphetamine and orders a JOC; the remaining counts and cases are DRI.  DA asks Court to accept agreement- 2 years probation, withheld, AODA conditions, court costs.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement.  Def makes a statement to the Court.  
Court orders:
2 yrs probation, withheld
Conditions of probation: regular drug testing, AODA/OWI assessment and driver's safety plan, get driver's license, programming per DOC, cognitive thinking program, $500 court costs (waives $18) to be paid in full from bond posted, no firearms for life, no voting until civil rights are restored, report to probation immediately.  
Appeal rights provided.  DNA to be provided to the Sheriff before leaving the building.

ADDRESS INFO for Sundance NMI Johnson Sr
Current: 2208 Short Street #7, Luck, WI 54853   (Effective: 05-17-2022)
Prior: 2208 Short Street  ;7, Luck, WI 54853
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on April 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.

09:48 AM Cases 20CT45, 21CF49, and 22CF8 called together.  Defendant Sundance NMI Johnson in court with attorney Eugene D Harrington.  Defendant in custody, appearing from Polk County Jail.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Sundance NMI Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: voluminous discovery received and reviewed, needs time to discuss with DA, anticipates a resolution.  State adds- offer sent 20 minutes ago; recites offer he just sent- plead to 1 of the felony possessions of meth, DRI balance, joint rec of 2 yrs probation and withheld sentence with standard AODA conditions.  Def to be in custody on other matters until 7/7/22.  Atty Harrington may update Court and get a different plea date if agreement is reached.  Status conference scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on March 10, 2022 at 09:45 am.

03:06 PM Cases 21CF49, 22CF08, and 20CT45 called together.  Defendant Sundance NMI Johnson in court with attorney Eugene D Harrington.  Defendant in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty Harrington by video.  All other parties appear in person.  Def waives all in person hearing KIV.  Case 20CT45 on for status conference.  Case 21CF49 is on for preliminary hearing.  State calls first witness, Sgt Cliff Casady, who is sworn in and testifies.  Witness has identified the defendant.  Venue is made.  Atty Harrington crosses.  State objects- beyond the scope and calls for legal conclusion; sustained.  State rests and asks for bindover.  Atty Harrington moves to dismiss 21CF49, argues in support of motion.  State argues against dismissal.  Atty Harrington enters rebuttal argument.  Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and the defendant probably committed it.  Case 21CF49 is bound over for further proceedings.  The State files information mirroring complaint.  Case proceeds to Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Case 22CF08 is on for preliminary hearing.  State calls first witness, Sgt Cliff Casady, who remains sworn in and testifies.  Defense stipulates to identity.  Venue is made.  Atty Harrington crosses.  State objects- beyond the scope; sustained.  State objects- beyond the scope; sustained.  State asks clarifying question regarding testimony.  State rests.  Witness steps down.  State asks for bindover.  No arguments entered.  Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and the defendant probably committed it.  Case 22CF08 is bound over for further proceedings.  The State files information mirroring complaint.  Case 22CF8 proceeds to Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on January 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

02:14 PM Cases 20CT45, 21CF49, and 22CF8 called together.  Defendant Sundance NMI Johnson in court with attorney Eugene D Harrington.  Defendant in custody, appearing from Polk County Jail (not in Burnett's custody).  James Jay Rennicke appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Sundance NMI Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney.    Cases 21CF49 and 22CF8 on for an Initial Appearances.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaints, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Atty Harrington preserves objections to PC of Complaints and requests PHs within 20 days.  NG pleas entered to misdemeanors.  If in custody, def may appear by Zoom; Atty Harrington notes def wants to appear in person for PH.  Preliminary Hearing scheduled for January 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Letter from DA re: Copy of summons and complaint to defendant

Bond to cover Burnett County cases 20CT45, 21CF49, and 21GF338.  No contact with the victims or residence.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
